Entries.default:
"Speaking of..." 

She blinks up at you as if trying to clear her sight.
"That I did. Still looking. If you're looking. You looking?" Her brow knits, and she emits a quiet burp, hiccup, or combination of the two.
"Don’t suppose you're looking for another sword-arm on that boat of yours."
"Why? You looking to leave here?"
"Only sober sword-arms."
"What do you have to offer me?"
"Grab your stuff and claim a bunk."
"I'm going to have to decline."
"Well... Deadlight just ain't what it's been. Bit hot for my tastes, if you catch my meaning." She swigs from her cup.
"And better a boat full of friends than a fort full of... full of..." She scowls.
"F... foes! Yeah, foes. Well, not foes, but not friends neither." She sighs into her cup.
"Oh. Wish that were a promise I could make you. Actually, no I don't. I'm pretty happy as am. As is? Whichever." She hiccups.
"You mean like silver and such?" She blinks wetly.
"Oh! Like what can I do! Sure, uh, I'm real good with my fists, and not half-bad with a blade neither. Might not look it, but I can take a hit and keep punching."
"Likely on account of being so full up of rum."
"You're... full up of rum!"

"Right good comeback, lass."

Serafen sighs and rubs the bridge of his nose.
"Sure about this, cap? Word's always been that Mirke here fell out the womb three sheets soused."
"Aye-aye, cap'n! See you aboard!" She winks and, with a hand holding her hat to her head, runs from the room.
"Oh stuff them sheets up your ballast hole you salty old furball."
"I was about to warn you about inviting too many pirates on board, but I'm warming up to this one." Maia grins.

"Another boisterous drunkard? I-

"Gods, I'm starting to sound like Edér."
"Well, she seems like fun!"
"Wait, really?" She blinks, then straightens - more or less - and salutes.
"Figured as much." She nods sullenly and takes a long draw from her cup.
